WorkItem.ClosedComment:
Thank you for your comments.

Our commitment to all Microsoft platforms is unchanged.

The upcoming release of Prism v4, will have both WPF and Silverlight, however there are two samples that will only be in Silverlight due to resource limitations.

However, there will be a series of blog posts and Patterns & Practices Symposium content that will be in WPF.  

If this does not address your requirements please write back.

Have a super day,

Karl Shifflett
WorkItem.Description: Are ya'll going to be doing any WPF examples cause starting to get the impression that there isn't a drive towards WPF as much as you have pushed for Silverlight development.  Some of the MVVM practices you are starting to code into Prism is targeted directly at Silverlight, prime example is "ChildWindow",  I can't use that code example since the childwindow control doesn't exist in WPF, it strictly Silverlight.  Starting to concern me since I am primarily a WPF developer at present haven't made the jump into RIA development yet.
